intro: Rhamnidium jamaicense, commonly known as Jamaican arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces palmate leaves with a velvety texture and is known for its starchy underground tubers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its nutritional value, it has been traditionally used as a food source in its native habitat.
